ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to write an academic article and the process of publishing an academic article.
I gained knowledge and skills form writing a paper, but nothing additional from the class comes to mind.
Got better at the research process

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths included discussions with colleagues; weaknesses included feedback from instructors.

strengths: We write papers. weaknesses: Everyone needs something different in this process. Feedback was not useful, and was pretty rude to several students. I liked the small group set up, but only because I had a group working on projects somewhat similar to my own. I know some group-mates had very little to offer one another. I think the class would be greatly improved if the faculty members leading it had diverse areas of expertise.

This was a great course. A lot of structure at the beginning, then support throughout the semester. Great model that future instructors can learn from. All the complaints I ever heard boiled down to "they didn't solve all my problems for me" or "they gave me advice I didn't agree with." If that's the worst anybody can say, you know you did a great job. The only thing I can think of that could have been better, was that we shouldn't have gone around the room to hear about everybody's project "real quick" that one day. It took 75 minutes. Wasn't realistic to think it could take any less. The usual smaller feedback sessions were better.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. Take it second year, it'll accelerate your research.
